definition: desperate getaway (from a battlefield)/to cut a bloody path out of a battlefield
blood/colloquial pr. [xie3]/CL:滴[di1],片[pian4]
surname Lu
road/CL:條|条[tiao2]/journey/route/line (bus etc)/sort/kind

sentences.english: We can fight our way out.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以杀出一条血路。

sentences.english: Executor, Zeratul shall find us passage to the warp gate.
sentences.chinese: 执行长，泽拉图会杀出一条通往传送门的血路。

sentences.english: I will work hard to blaze a trail in this new company.
sentences.chinese: 我一定会努力工作在新公司杀出一条血路。

sentences.english: Lets see about that , I will work hard to blaze a trail in this new company.
sentences.chinese: 等着瞧吧，我一定会努力工作在新公司杀出一条血路。

sentences.english: Having been surrounded by the enemy, we must fight our way out.
sentences.chinese: 我们已被敌人包围，必须杀出一条血路。

sentences.english: One way out, I dashed up, until the rebellion against the king.
sentences.chinese: 一条血路冲出，我急奔而上，直至叛乱逆王面前。

definition: to redouble a siege
to force one's way out of encirclement/to break through
broad and open road (idiom); fig. brilliant future prospects
to charge
dead end/(fig.) the road to disaster
single-handedly (idiom)
blood-soaked
lit. to cut one's way through thistles and thorns (idiom)/fig. to overcome all obstacles on the way/to break through hardships/to blaze a new trail
to break a siege/to break out of an enclosure
to rush out
to go all out for sth at risk of one's life
to risk one's life
to flee/to go into exile (from prison)
to seek life in death (idiom); to fight for one's life
to charge forward
to make a surprise attack/to pounce on (an enemy)
